org.wildfly.security.util

Class Base64

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.util.Base64

  • public final class Base64
extends Object
    Utility class for handling Base64 encoded values.
    Author:
    Darran Lofthouse, Farah Juma

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Base64() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int base64Decode(byte[] encoded, int offset, int len, ByteStringBuilder target, int[] decodeAlphabet)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
      static byte[] base64Decode(char[] encoded, int offset, int[] decodeAlphabet)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
      static byte[] base64Decode(char[] encoded, int offset, int len, int[] decodeAlphabet)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
      static void base64Decode(CharacterArrayReader reader, byte[] target, int[] decodeAlphabet)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the given lookup table.
      static int base64Decode(int ch, int[] decodeAlphabet)
      Base-64 decode a single character using the given lookup table.
      static void base64DecodeBCrypt(CharacterArrayReader reader, byte[] target)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the bcrypt alphabet.
      static void base64DecodeModCrypt(CharacterArrayReader reader, byte[] target)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the modular crypt alphabet.
      static int base64DecodeModCrypt(int ch)
      Base-64 decode a single character with the modular crypt alphabet (DES/MD5/SHA crypt).
      static void base64DecodeModCryptLE(CharacterArrayReader reader, byte[] target, int[] interleave)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array with an interleave table, using the modular crypt style little-endian scheme.
      static int base64DecodeStandard(byte[] encoded, int offset, ByteStringBuilder target)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet.
      static int base64DecodeStandard(byte[] encoded, int offset, int len, ByteStringBuilder target)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet.
      static byte[] base64DecodeStandard(char[] encoded, int offset)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet.
      static byte[] base64DecodeStandard(char[] encoded, int offset, int len)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet.
      static void base64DecodeStandard(CharacterArrayReader reader, byte[] target)
      Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet.
      static void base64Encode(ByteStringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src, char[] alphabet, boolean doPadding)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
      static void base64Encode(ByteStringBuilder target, int a, char[] alphabet)
      Base-64 encode a single byte with the given alphabet and append the resulting character to the given ByteStringBuilder.
      static void base64Encode(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src, char[] alphabet, boolean doPadding)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
      static void base64Encode(StringBuilder target, int a, char[] alphabet)
      Base-64 encode a single byte with the given alphabet and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
      static void base64EncodeBCrypt(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the bcrypt alphabet.
      static void base64EncodeBCrypt(StringBuilder target, int a)
      Base-64 encode a single byte with the bcrypt alphabet and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
      static void base64EncodeModCrypt(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and modular crypt alphabet.
      static void base64EncodeModCrypt(StringBuilder target, int a)
      Base-64 encode a single byte with the modular crypt alphabet (DES/MD5/SHA crypt) and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
      static void base64EncodeModCryptLE(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the modular crypt style little-endian scheme.
      static void base64EncodeStandard(ByteStringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src, boolean doPadding)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet and optionally include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
      static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet but do not include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
      static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target, ByteArrayInputStream src, boolean doPadding)
      Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet and optionally include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
      static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target, int a)
      Base-64 encode a single byte with the standard Base64 alphabet, as specified in Table 1 in RFC 4648, and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
      static int calculateDecodedLength(char[] encoded, int offset, int len)
      Calculate the number of bytes that will be needed to store the result of Base-64 decoding the given sequence of characters using the given offset and length.
      static int[] getDecodeAlphabet(char[] alphabet, boolean includePaddingChar)
      Get a lookup table that can be used when decoding characters from the given alphabet.

        public Base64()

    • Method Detail

      • getDecodeAlphabet

        public static int[] getDecodeAlphabet(char[] alphabet,
                      boolean includePaddingChar)
        Get a lookup table that can be used when decoding characters from the given alphabet.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - the alphabet used for encoding
        includePaddingChar - whether or not the padding character, '=', should be included in the lookup table
        Returns:
        a lookup table that can be used for decoding characters from the given alphabet

      • base64DecodeModCryptLE

        public static void base64DecodeModCryptLE(CharacterArrayReader reader,
                          byte[] target,
                          int[] interleave)
                                   throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array with an interleave table, using the modular crypt style little-endian scheme.
        Parameters:
        reader - the character reader
        target - the target array
        interleave - the interleave table to use
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly

      • base64Decode

        public static void base64Decode(CharacterArrayReader reader,
                byte[] target,
                int[] decodeAlphabet)
                         throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the given lookup table. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of characters but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        reader - the character reader
        target - the target array
        decodeAlphabet - the lookup table to use when decoding
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of characters contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64Decode

        public static byte[] base64Decode(char[] encoded,
                  int offset,
                  int len,
                  int[] decodeAlphabet)
                           throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                  IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of characters but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the characters to decode
        offset - the offset of the first character to decode
        len - the number of characters to decode
        decodeAlphabet - the lookup table to use when decoding
        Returns:
        an appropriately-sized byte array containing the decoded bytes
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of characters contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64Decode

        public static byte[] base64Decode(char[] encoded,
                  int offset,
                  int[] decodeAlphabet)
                           throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                  IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into a newly created byte array, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of characters but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the characters to decode
        offset - the offset of the first character to decode
        decodeAlphabet - the lookup table to use when decoding
        Returns:
        an appropriately-sized byte array containing the decoded bytes
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of characters contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64Decode

        public static int base64Decode(byte[] encoded,
               int offset,
               int len,
               ByteStringBuilder target,
               int[] decodeAlphabet)
                        throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                               IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the given alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of bytes but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the bytes to decode
        offset - the offset of the first byte to decode
        len - the number of bytes to decode
        target - the target byte string builder
        decodeAlphabet - the lookup table to use when decoding
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that were decoded
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of bytes is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of bytes contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64Decode

        public static int base64Decode(int ch,
               int[] decodeAlphabet)
                        throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Base-64 decode a single character using the given lookup table.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character
        decodeAlphabet - the lookup table to use when decoding
        Returns:
        the byte
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the character is not in the alphabet

      • base64DecodeModCrypt

        public static void base64DecodeModCrypt(CharacterArrayReader reader,
                        byte[] target)
                                 throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the modular crypt alphabet.
        Parameters:
        reader - the character reader
        target - the target array
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly

      • base64DecodeStandard

        public static void base64DecodeStandard(CharacterArrayReader reader,
                        byte[] target)
                                 throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                        IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of characters but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        reader - the character reader
        target - the target array
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of characters is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of characters contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64DecodeStandard

        public static int base64DecodeStandard(byte[] encoded,
                       int offset,
                       int len,
                       ByteStringBuilder target)
                                throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of bytes but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the bytes to decode
        offset - the offset of the first byte to decode
        len - the number of bytes to decode
        target - the target byte string builder
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that were decoded
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of bytes is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of bytes contains an invalid number of padding characters

      • base64DecodeStandard

        public static int base64DecodeStandard(byte[] encoded,
                       int offset,
                       ByteStringBuilder target)
                                throws InvalidKeySpecException,
                                       IllegalArgumentException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder, starting from the given offset, using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet. The padding character, '=', is allowed at the end of the encoded sequence of bytes but it is not required. If a padding character is provided, the correct number of padding characters must be present.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the bytes to decode
        offset - the offset of the first byte to decode
        target - the target byte string builder
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that were decoded
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the end of the sequence of bytes is reached unexpectedly
        IllegalArgumentException - if the encoded sequence of bytes contains an invalid number of padding characters

                      byte[] target)
                               throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Base-64 decode a sequence of characters into an appropriately-sized byte array, using the standard scheme and the bcrypt alphabet.

        target - the target array

      • base64DecodeModCrypt

        public static int base64DecodeModCrypt(int ch)
                                throws InvalidKeySpecException
        Base-64 decode a single character with the modular crypt alphabet (DES/MD5/SHA crypt).
        Parameters:
        ch - the character
        Returns:
        the byte
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySpecException - if the character is not in the alphabet

      • base64Encode

        public static void base64Encode(StringBuilder target,
                ByteArrayInputStream src,
                char[] alphabet,
                boolean doPadding)
        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        src - the source byte array input stream to encode
        alphabet - the alphabet to use when encoding
        doPadding - whether or not padding characters should be appended to the encoded result

      • base64Encode

        public static void base64Encode(ByteStringBuilder target,
                ByteArrayInputStream src,
                char[] alphabet,
                boolean doPadding)
        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder using the standard scheme and the given alphabet.
        Parameters:
        target - the target byte string builder
        src - the source byte array input stream to encode
        alphabet - the alphabet to use when encoding
        doPadding - whether or not padding characters should be appended to the encoded result

      • base64Encode

        public static void base64Encode(StringBuilder target,
                int a,
                char[] alphabet)
        Base-64 encode a single byte with the given alphabet and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        a - the byte
        alphabet - the alphabet to use when encoding

        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and modular crypt alphabet.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        src - the source byte array input stream to encode

      • base64EncodeStandard

        public static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target,
                        ByteArrayInputStream src)
        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet but do not include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        src - the source byte array input stream to encode

      • base64EncodeStandard

        public static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target,
                        ByteArrayInputStream src,
                        boolean doPadding)
        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given StringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet and optionally include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        src - the source byte array input stream to encode
        doPadding - whether or not padding characters should be appended to the encoded result

      • base64EncodeStandard

        public static void base64EncodeStandard(ByteStringBuilder target,
                        ByteArrayInputStream src,
                        boolean doPadding)
        Base-64 encode a sequence of bytes into the given ByteStringBuilder using the standard scheme and the standard alphabet and optionally include padding characters at the end of the encoded result.
        Parameters:
        target - the target byte string builder
        src - the source byte array to encode
        doPadding - whether or not padding characters should be appended to the encoded result

        src - the source byte array input stream to encode

      • base64EncodeModCrypt

        public static void base64EncodeModCrypt(StringBuilder target,
                        int a)
        Base-64 encode a single byte with the modular crypt alphabet (DES/MD5/SHA crypt) and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        a - the byte

      • base64EncodeStandard

        public static void base64EncodeStandard(StringBuilder target,
                        int a)
        Base-64 encode a single byte with the standard Base64 alphabet, as specified in Table 1 in RFC 4648, and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        a - the byte

      • base64EncodeBCrypt

        public static void base64EncodeBCrypt(StringBuilder target,
                      int a)
        Base-64 encode a single byte with the bcrypt alphabet and append the resulting character to the given StringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        target - the target string builder
        a - the byte

      • calculateDecodedLength

        public static int calculateDecodedLength(char[] encoded,
                         int offset,
                         int len)
        Calculate the number of bytes that will be needed to store the result of Base-64 decoding the given sequence of characters using the given offset and length. The padding character, '=', is allowed in the encoded sequence of characters but it is not required.
        Parameters:
        encoded - the characters that will be decoded
        offset - the offset of the first character that will be decoded
        len - the number of characters that will be decoded
        Returns:
        the size of the byte array that will be needed to store the decoded bytes
